title: What year was it legal to change your name? Why did this become a rule? - Quora
tags: Legal Issues and Law in Everyday Life

response.answer_text: I’m not a lawyer, but as I understand it, English common law has allowed people to use any name they want as long as they aren’t doing it in an attempt to defraud anyone, run away from debts, etc. More recently, courts have recorded name changes. This way, there’s some official paperwork to satisfy the clerk who issues you a new driver’s license or whatever with your new name that everything’s on the up-and-up.
